words.1.foment: To create a trouble or violence or make it worse
words.2.wary: Marked by keen caution sn watchfull prudence
words.3.degrade: to treat poorly and without respect; to make quality of something worse
words.4.penitent: feeling or showing that you are sorry for having done something wrong
words.5.indiffrent: marked by a lack of interest or importance ; neither good or bad
words.6.relegate: banish to an inferior position; lower ; drop
words.7.gregarious: liking to be with other people; living in groups
words.8.elicit: draw a response ; sometimes with difficulty
words.10.permeate: to spread through something and be present in every part of it
words.201.diatribe: a long and angry speech or piece of writing attacking and criticizing somebody or something
words.204.obviate: to anticipate and prevent(as a situation) or make unnecessary(as an action)
words.206.pariah: a person who is not acceptable to society and is avoided by everyone
words.208.ingratiate: to do things in order to make someone like you ; especially someone who will be usefull to you; to gain favour or approval for yourself by doing or saying things that people like
words.210.austere: severely and strictly moral;having no pleasures or comforts
